Docutils' implementation of reStructuredText comes with various interpreted text roles as standard. These are:

* Abbreviations: for instance, :abbreviation:`RST` is the abbreviation for reStructuredText.

* Acronyms: :acronym:`RIV` could be the acronym for "reStructuredText is versatile".

* Code may be specified :code:`import docutils`, although without any custom modification
  it results in the same as ``literal``.

* Emphasis: :emphasis:`emphasis`.

* Literal: :literal:`literal`.

* Math: e.g. the area of a circle is :math:`A_\text{c} = (\pi/4) d^2`.

* PEP-reference: e.g. :pep-reference:`8`

* RFC-reference: e.g. :rfc-reference:`5545`.

* Strong: :strong:`some strong text`.

* Subscript: :subscript:`Down Low`.

* Superscript: :superscript:`up high`.

* Title-reference: :title-reference:`This text is the name of a published work`.
